item.title: Kungsleden Day 19 - Abisko!!
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 3:43 KM: 16.55 Elevation gain in Meters: 133 Start: Campground before Abisko NP, Abiskojaure site End: Abisko All in one It’s hard to write something on this last day. A lot of mixed feelings, happy to be done but already sad that the adventure is over. Wishing for a new one, but still hating the mosquitoes :) We got up at 8 am and left around 9 am.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 18 - The end is near
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 6:25 KM: 26.08 Elevation gain in Meters: 353 Start: Under Bossosváráš End: Campground before Abisko NP, Abiskojaure site Reindeer in the evening Shortly before we fell asleep the night before, we heard some strange noises from outside the tent. After a while we decided to look whats going on. In the far we saw a really big heard of reindeers and some sami people that were moving them with the help of dogs.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 17 - Tjäktjatjattja pass
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 6:47 KM: 25.22 Elevation gain in Meters: 599 Start: Next to Kuoperjåkka shelter End: Under Bossosváráš Morning We slept pretty good, it was a bit a change of too hot -> getting out of the sleepingbag, then too cold -> getting in again… and so on :) But in the morning the mosquitoes already waited for us. So we packed together as fast as possible and went to the emergency shelter to have breakfast.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 16 - Parting our ways
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 6:44 KM: 24.70 Elevation gain in Meters: 511 Start: Fjäll after the climb from Teusajaurestugorna End: Next to Kuoperjåkka shelter Perfect Night The Temperature was perfect during the night and we slept from 10 pm till 8 am, it was perfect. But getting up was tough, the mosquitoes and knots already waited for us. So we packed together fast and started hiking. View during the early hike

item.title: Kungsleden Day 15 - Boat & Bus
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 4:42 KM: 16.04 Elevation gain in Meters: 821 Start: Sáltoluokta End: Fjäll after the climb from Teusajaurestugorna Morning We slept incredibly well in our room! No mosquitoes and a nice temperature, I think I slept for around 10 hours. Then we had a small breakfast in our room and off we went. First thing on the todo list was to take the boat to cross the lake. But this is really fast and takes about 10 minutes.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 14 - Sáltoluokta
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 5:31 KM: 23.21 Elevation gain in Meters: 340 Start: Under Mártevárásj End: Sáltoluokta Morning I woke up around 6 am as it was too hot in the tent. After removing the rainfly partially it got a bit better. But on the way back into the tent, around 10 mosquitoes followed me… so it was hunting time again. Unbelievable that they are now on the fjäll as well, we really hope it gets better in the next 1-2 days.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 13 - Skierffe
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 8:08 KM: 26.82 Elevation gain in Meters: 1008 Start: Fjäll after Jågge shelter End: Under Mártevárásj Down again The night was on the warm side but we slept perfectly! Especially after the mosquito infested hostel room… Tent on the fjäll First target of the day was to reach boat station. Schedule of the motorboat was 9 am and 5 pm but there was also a rowing option.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 12 - Out of Kvikkjokk
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 8:18 KM: 28.82 Elevation gain in Meters: 937 Start: Kvikkjokk End: Fjäll after Jågge shelter Back on the trail After not the best night thanks to the mosquitoes I got up at 7 am and decided to get breakfast. Nicole slept for another hour :) Even though we hadn’t booked breakfast, I was able to get one (but without eggs) and it was a great start into the day.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 11 - Nero Town Day
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 1:35 KM: 6:05 Elevation gain in Meters: 33 Start: Near Lástak on the trail End: Kvikkjokk Good morning We slept good and got up around 7 am, it was warm more or less the whole night. But in the morning the mosquitoes were still attached to our tent, so putting it down was bit of a challenge. Mosquito infested tent Way down We hit the trail shortly before 8 am.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 10 - Getting close to Kvikkjokk
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 9:53 KM: 35.36 Elevation gain in Meters: 969 Start: Fjäll near Tjäurakåtan End: Near Lástak on the trail Windy night Thankfully we and the tent survived the windy night :) Early morning the wind stopped completely. For part of the night I listed to music again to kill the noises from the wind, that works quite good. In the morning we got a beautiful view out of the tent.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 9 - First real boat ride
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 7:47 KM: 27.08 Elevation gain in Meters: 811 Start: Top of the Fjäll before the boatride to Vuonatjviken End: Fjäll near Tjäurakåtan Boatride There was a bit wind before we went to bed, but not an issue compared to the night before. We both slept pretty good, the swim/shower in the lake helped with that i guess :) View of the camp in the morning

item.title: Kungsleden Day 8 - Windy night
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 6:31 KM: 21.83 Elevation gain in Meters: 617 Start: After Pieljekaisestugan End: Top of the Fjäll before the boatride to Vuonatjviken Waking up from the wind I had a bit of a hard time to fall asleep because of the wind. Because it hit the tent quite hard, there was a lot of noise inside of it… everyday another challenge ;-) At around 1 am i woke up again and couldn’t fell asleep because of the wind.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 7 - Next Town, Adolfsström
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 10:11 KM: 35.51 Elevation gain in Meters: 825 Start: Near Svájpavallie End: After Pieljekaisestugan Good Morning Yesterday shortly before I fell asleep, it started to rain. Not sure how long it continued, but in the morning it was mostly dry. ‌And the mosquitoes were gone! At least for the moment ;-) View from the tent spot It was quite cloudy, but the sun sometimes managed to push trough and spent some heat.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 6 - On the plateau
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 7:04 KM: 25.45 Elevation gain in Meters: 417 Start: Bridges after Rävfallstugan End: Near Svájpavallie Cold night The night was cold, the close river probably didn‘t helped with that… I had a really hard time to get out of the sleepingbag but as soon as the sunshine hit me, it was ok 😀 As we reached the plateau yesterday before we set camp, the trail was mostly flat.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 5 - Waking up in a bed
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 8:09 KM: 30.24 Elevation gain in Meters: 1160 Start: Ammarnäs End: Bridges after Rävfallstugan Waking up and Breakfast Even if we love our tent and camping in the wild, a real bed is amazing after some days outside. The same goes for a shower and a breakfast. We had all of it in Ammarnäs, but then it was time to hit the trail again. During the night it rained lightly, but when we started around 10, it was still cloudy but dry.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 4 - First Town
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 5:21 KM: 19.15 Elevation gain in Meters: 405 Start: After Vuomatjåhkka shelter End: Ammarnäs Next stop Ammarnäs We slept well, I woke up once and it sounded like light rain but in the morning it was cloudy but not raining. First goal of the day was the emergency shelter on top of the next pass. It took us an hour for 3.6km and 270m of elevation gain. We then had breakfast in the shelter.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 3 - From the water back to the mountains
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 8:11 KM: 27.4 Elevation gain in Meters: 934 Start: Before Tärnasjöstugorna‌ End: After Vuomatjåhkka shelter Warm start After a cozy night we woke up and the sun was still shining and no clouds in sight. That was a pleasant surprise. Then sun was warming us up and this helped to get started. The first kms followed along the lake, through the forest. Forest Hiking along Tärnasjön

item.title: Kungsleden Day 2 - Cold night, beautiful day
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 7:24 KM: 22.8 Elevation gain in Meters: 439 Start: Shortly after Viterskalsstugan‌ End: Before Tärnasjöstugorna Start of day 2 Day 2 started for me at 3am, as i had to pee. It‘s crazy to get up this early and realize that it‘s bright as during the day. 3am in the morning Overall we slept pretty good, it was on the cold side but tolerable.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 1 - The start (is always hard?)
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 3:53 KM: 12.08 Elevation gain in Meters: 528 Start: Hemavan End: Shortly after Viterskalsstugan Before the start After we arrived by plane we repacked our stuff directly in front of the mini airport building. Then we went off to get food for the next ~4 days which it will take to reach Ammarnäs. The local ICA had a nice selection of food. Then we went for a final meal before the start at the „Auroras kök“ and we both choose the Beyond Burger (Vegetarian).

item.title: Kungsleden Day 0 - Travel, getting to the start
item.description: Overview KM: 0 by foot Start: Rheinfelden End: Hemavan Train, Plane, Hotel and Plane again Getting to the start of the Kungsleden is quite a journey, at least when you live in switzerland or Rheinfelden to be more specific. There are various options, but we decided to go by plane in the end. As there are no direct (or even combined) flights available, we had to split the journey. So the first flight was Zurich -> Stockholm and as there was no flight which allowed us to capture the next flight to Hemavan on the same day, we went for a Hotel in Stockholm.

item.title: Kungsleden T -1 days - Finalizing the equipment
item.description: Equipment for the Kungsleden For this year i wanted to put everything into a lighterpack and i really did it 🥳 This is mostly for myself and should help me in the future to optimize the weight. Lighterpack Base weight could definitely be better and we are considering a ZPacks triplex for the future. But this is a topic for another day. How does all this stuff look like? I captured two pictures of my equipment, one shows most of the stuff just loose.

item.title: Kungsleden T -4 days
Hello from my mobile
item.description: This is a test post created on my mobile with working copy. Hello again. Update 16.06.2021: Now from iaWriter 👍🏻 Now with a jpeg picture :)

item.title: Overview
item.description: In 2020 we hiked the Swiss Part of the Via Alpina (Swiss Route #1) https://www.schweizmobil.ch/de/wanderland/route-01.html More information about the hike will follow in the future…

item.title: Automate GitHub Pages with Travis CI
item.description: To have a CICD pipeline for my github pages site, i use the following travis config. GITHUB_AUTH_SECRET is set in the settings page of the respective travis project. ---install:- curl -LO https://github.com/gohugoio/hugo/releases/download/v${HUGO_RELEASE}/hugo_extended_${HUGO_RELEASE}_Linux-64bit.deb- sudo dpkg -i hugo*.debscript:- hugodeploy:- provider:pageslocal_dir:publicrepo:richardstrnad/richardstrnad.github.iotarget_branch:masterskip_cleanup:truegithub_token:$GITHUB_AUTH_SECRETkeep_history:trueon:branch:masterenv:global:- HUGO_RELEASE=0.

item.title: About
item.description: Richard Strnad Senior Network Engineer CCIE #43536 Certifications: CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure (R&S) #43536 DevNet 500 Cisco Certified DevNet Professional Red Hat Certified Specialist in Ansible Automation (EX407) Professional experiences Senior Network Engineer (Full time employee) Netcloud AG, www.netcloud.ch Industry: Information Technology & Services Privately held company, 150-200 employee Senior Network Engineer (Full time employee) eternalNet AG, www.eternalnet.ch Industry: Information Technology & Services Privately held company, 1-10 employee

item.title: Hello World
